intro: Sclerochiton triacanthus, commonly known as the three-spined sclerochiton, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
